local.name: Lahore  Chapter
local.description: This chapter includes alumni from Lahore, Kasur, Kot Radha Kishen, Sharaqpur Sharif, Muridke, Narang Mandi, Sheikhupura, Chunian, Pattoki, Renala Khurd, Okara, Depalpur, Haveli Lakha, Hujra Shah Muqeem, and Manwala. Together, this diverse and vibrant region forms a strong alumni network that fosters learning, collaboration, and professional growth through shared experiences and opportunities.

local.name: Gujranwala–Gujrat–Sialkot Chapter
local.description: This chapter brings together alumni from Gujranwala, Gujrat, Sialkot, Daska, Wazirabad, Kamoke, Hafizabad, Alipur Chattha, Lala Musa, and Kharian. Representing an important industrial and commercial belt, this chapter provides valuable networking, mentorship, and development opportunities for alumni.

local.name: Faisalabad Chapter
local.description: The Faisalabad chapter includes alumni from Faisalabad, Jaranwala, Samundri, Gojra, Toba Tek Singh, Chiniot, and Jhang. With representation from one of Pakistan's major economic hubs, this chapter facilitates rich learning experiences, professional collaboration, and continuous growth for its members.

local.name: Sargodha Chapter
local.description: This chapter consists of alumni from Sargodha, Khushab, Jauharabad, Bhalwal, and Mianwali. These interconnected cities form a cohesive alumni community that supports peer learning, career development, and collective progress through regular engagement and knowledge-sharing.

local.name: Multan Chapter
local.description: The Multan chapter covers alumni living in Multan, Khanewal, Lodhran, Vehari, and nearby areas such as Jahanian. This chapter represents a dynamic blend of professional fields and offers alumni meaningful opportunities for growth, leadership building, and networking.

local.name: Bahawalpur–Bahawalnagar Chapter
local.description: This chapter includes alumni from Bahawalpur, Bahawalnagar, Chishtian, Haroonabad, Hasilpur, and surrounding towns such as Fatehpur. It serves as a strong platform for alumni to connect, learn, and advance professionally while contributing to community development in the region.

local.name: Sahiwal Chapter
local.description: The Sahiwal chapter brings together alumni from Sahiwal, Pakpattan, Arifwala, Chichawatni, and Shorkot. This chapter fosters collaboration across education, business, and social sectors while promoting continuous learning and mutual growth among its members.

local.name: Southern Punjab Chapter
local.description: This chapter comprises alumni from Dera Ghazi Khan, Jampur, Rajanpur, Kot Addu, Layyah, Muzaffargarh, Jatoi, Liaqatpur, Rahim Yar Khan, and Sadiqabad. Spanning a broad yet connected region, it empowers alumni by building networks that encourage personal development, knowledge exchange, and career enhancement.

local.name: Islamabad Chapter
local.description: The Islamabad–Rawalpindi chapter consists of alumni from Islamabad, Rawalpindi, Wah Cantt, Tarbela Ghazi, Attock, Chakwal, Dina, and Jhelum. Located at the center of national activity, this chapter provides strong opportunities for professional advancement through interaction, mentorship, and innovative learning.

local.name: KPK Chapter
local.description: This chapter includes alumni from Peshawar, Kohat, Bannu, Batkhela, Buner, Parachinar, Abbottabad, and Mansehra. Bringing together graduates across northern Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, this chapter promotes academic enrichment, leadership growth, and meaningful professional connections.

local.name: Kashmir Chapter
local.description: The Kashmir chapter includes alumni from Azad Jammu Kashmir, Bhimber, Kotli, and Poonch. With strong ties to the region's educational and social landscape, this chapter supports its members through collaborative learning, community engagement, and skill-building opportunities.

local.name: Sindh Chapter
local.description: This chapter comprises alumni from Karachi and Ghotki, representing both the metropolitan center and upper Sindh. It serves as a bridge for alumni across diverse industries, offering opportunities for career growth, networking, and continuous professional development.

local.name: Balochistan Chapter
local.description: The Balochistan chapter consists of alumni from Quetta and Dalbandin. United by regional pride and professional ambition, this chapter enables alumni to collaborate, learn, and grow through shared experiences and development-focused activities.

local.name: Northern Pakistan Chapter
local.description: This chapter includes alumni from Gilgit and Skardu, representing the northernmost regions of Pakistan. Through this chapter, alumni benefit from a supportive community that encourages personal enrichment, learning opportunities, and professional networking despite geographical distances.

international.name: United Arab Emirates Chapter
international.description: Connect with UOL alumni in the UAE. Participate in networking events, professional workshops, and social gatherings across Dubai, Abu Dhabi, and other Emirates.

international.name: Canada Chapter
international.description: Join the UOL alumni network in Canada. Connect with fellow graduates, attend events, and build your professional network across Canadian cities.

international.name: Australia Chapter
